questions.question: What is nutrition?
questions.answer: The process by which living organisms take in and utilize food material for growth, energy and repair is called nutrition.

questions.question: Name the types of heterotrophic nutrition.
Which organ in humans secretes bile juice?
questions.answer: The liver secretes bile juice which helps in digestion of fats.

questions.question: What is the role of salivary amylase?
questions.answer: Salivary amylase converts starch into simple sugars (maltose) in the mouth.

questions.question: Differentiate between aerobic and anaerobic respiration.
questions.answer: Aerobic respiration occurs in presence of oxygen and releases more energy, while anaerobic respiration occurs without oxygen and releases less energy.

questions.question: Where does aerobic respiration occur in a cell?
Write the chemical equation for aerobic respiration.
Name the fluid which transports oxygen in human body.
questions.answer: Blood, specifically the red blood cells with hemoglobin.

questions.question: What is the role of xylem?
questions.answer: Xylem transports water and minerals from roots to all parts of the plant.

questions.question: Which part of the heart pumps deoxygenated blood to lungs?
Name the vein that carries oxygenated blood.
What is excretion?
questions.answer: The process of removing metabolic waste products from the body.

questions.question: Name the basic functional unit of the kidney.
How is urine formed?
questions.answer: By the process of filtration, reabsorption and secretion in the nephrons of the kidney.
